data.title: [html] do not suggest to close an already closed tag

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:38:23.027Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: none
---
When working on html file - the editor suggets I would close an already closed tag.
Tried uninstalling and other things but it didn't work
![lswe0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8089740/30873248-3385a82c-a2f5-11e7-8425-974fbe7b75aa.png).
Happened to me on other versions too.



Steps to Reproduce:
(note I'm not sure it happens to everyone)
1. create a tag. let the editor automatically create the closed tag. or close it yourself
2. start creating a tag between those two.

data.title: Dev tools do not link to origin
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (a5210bcbda97166904ce4c08ee296cb98fccfcd9, 2017-09-26T05:11:30.780Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: Many

Testing #34756

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Log messages from extension
2. Origin shown in dev tools is always console.ts:112
3. The test item seems to say that the link should be to the actual origin?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9205389/30871674-7f15d4d2-a29c-11e7-9dc3-143ff81304e4.png)

data.title: showOpenDialog: improve spec of 'openFiles' and 'openFolders'
data.body:
Testing #34821, Linux

- What's the default of 'openFolders' and 'openFiles'? Naturally, it would be 'false', but both false doesn't make sense to have as default for the OpenDialogOptions
- The spec says: `openFiles: *Only* allow to select files`. What does it mean if also openFolders is true?
- The spec says:  `*Note* that not all operating systems support to select files and folders in one dialog instance`. How would API users know if they now can use files and folders together?

Suggestions:
- a single property: resourceTypes: FILES | FOLDERS | ANY,  default: ANY
- a API to find out what is supported on the current OS

data.title: FSProvider: dependency on uri.path
data.body:

The current API doesn't allow to have resources without a path since it tries to read it in some places:

- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/files/electron-browser/remoteFileService.ts#L37

data.title: Extensions viewlet gets cleared on workspace folder add
data.body:
1. Open extensions viewlet -> notice installed extensions shown and recommendations
2. Explorer -> add new workspace folder
3. Back to extensions viewlet -> it is completely emtpy

Once I search for something and cancel the search the extensions viewlet gets healthy

data.title: Editing workspace file from within workspace doesn't really work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.17 a5210bcbda97166904ce4c08ee296cb98fccfcd9
- OS Version: macOS

While testing #29871:

- open a multi root workspace
- open the workspace file as file (in order to add folder names)

Observe:
- the contents is greyed but it is possible to edit a little bit, e.g. I could add `,"name":"other"` but whitespace (newlines, spaces) wouldn't work.
- the edited file is saved, but the changes are not picked up by VS Code.
- after a "Reload window" the new folder names showed up correctly

data.title: Not clear how editor.accessibilitySuport is tied to the ScreenReader dialog
data.body: Currently this relationship is not quite clear. Due to this when the user in your screen reader dialog says "No" and later in life wants to get this behaior back it is hard for him - since he is not aware of the relationship between editor.accessibilitySupport and the dialog (and there is no other way to bring the dialog back).

data.title: Encoding cannot be configured for "first line" based language associations

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #34769

Create a file `hello`. Paste the following contents:
```
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<note>
  <to>Tove</to>
  <from>Jani</from>
  <heading>Reminder</heading>
  <body>Don't forget me this weekend! ș ț </body>
</note>
```

* Save the file as UTF8 without BOM
* Open the file. It is correctly recognized as XML.
* Configure:
```
	"files.encoding": "utf16be",
	"[xml]": {
		"files.encoding": "utf8"
	}
```

* try to open `hello`. Observe: it is opened with utf16be:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5047891/30863380-321eafde-a2d1-11e7-9c1c-288db6883ea6.png)

data.title: Adding folder to single folder workspace collapses the first folder
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/31195

Steps to Reproduce:

1. start with single-folder workspace
2. do not expand anything (the folder is expanded already)
3. add another folder

=> the first folder shows as collapsed

![flicker_chrome58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/30863222-cbcc85d0-a2d0-11e7-8a86-ebd57ac21ab2.gif)

data.title: Emmet activates on * and take 150ms to do that
data.body: Two things aren't clear to me * why does emmet activate on *? * why does it load for 150ms?

data.title: Should MarkdownString offer appendLine
data.body:
Testing #34962

When writing markdown it would be cool if I could do something like this:

```ts
			documentation.
				appendLine('## Heading').
				appendLine('Some text').
				appendLine('* item one').
				appendLine('* item two').
				appendLine('* item three');
```

In addition the method appendMarkdown could be named append since the receiver is a MarkdownString. And should there be a append that takes a MarkdownString?

data.body: After extension installation, I have to reload to make it working, but my remote connection(ssh, ipython, beeline) in terminal disconnected the same time.

data.title: Scrollbar slider should have a min height

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #34868

[emoji-test.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/1333136/emoji-test.txt)

* save this file as UTF8 with bom (I think it is already)
* configure `"terminal.integrated.scrollback": 5000`
* run `chcp 65001`
* run `cat emoji-test.txt`
* Obseve: the scrollbar slider becomes very small and it is difficult to grab it with the mouse
* It would be nice if the mouse cursor would not be an `I` or if it would give hover feedback:

![slider](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5047891/30861829-46c29fc2-a2cc-11e7-93d7-41c7309522bb.gif)

data.title: Find dialog wrong size in Italian + Wrong "No results" Italian localization
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.16.1 - OS Version: macOS 10.12.6 (16G29) Steps to Reproduce: 1. Set Italian language, or start from command line (`code --locale it`) 2. Open the Find dialog (cmd+F) 3. See the input field of the Find dialog collapsed, probably to allow the "Nessuna impostazione corrispondente" ("No results" in English) to be shown correctly. Additional comments: Apart from the too narrow input field, that prevents the user to check what he's writing in the field (see attached screenshots), "Nessuna impostazione corrente" is not a correct translation for "No results"; it should be "Nessun risultato" or "Nessuna corrispondenza". Reproduces without extensions: Yes

[emoji-test.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/1333136/emoji-test.txt)

* save this file as UTF8 with bom (I think it is already)
* configure `"terminal.integrated.scrollback": 5000`
* run `chcp 65001`
* run `cat emoji-test.txt`
* scroll to `British Virgin Islands`
* try to select with the mouse:
